course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Making Chamber Music A
course.description: Through weekly coaching sessions and public performances, students will learn all facets of chamber music making at a high level. Students will also learn team-building skills and develop attentiveness to partners in an ensemble. This is a course for students who are highly motivated, and sufficiently trained and experienced in classical music performance. Enrollment in the course requires instructor's approval based on audition outcome.

reviews.author: daydreaming
reviews.comment_content:
You will just have to work on one chosen piece with your classmate.

Professor will discuss with you on the rhythms, style, dynamics.... of the piece.
reviews.comment_teaching:
They have really different styles of teaching.
Their focus of teaching also vary due to the different kinds of instruments they play.

Amy is super nice and she is a really experienced teacher in chamber music and piano. If you play the piano, she will be able to give you a lot of tips.
reviews.comment_grading: People normally get good grade, teachers are quite lenient.
reviews.comment_workload:
You are expected to spend extra time to rehearse with your group-mates every week before the lesson time. If you can get along with your group-mates, this should be fun!

One midterm and one final performance in the end of the semester.
